stance_1: I avoid eating much beef or pork
stance_2: I eat chicken and turkey regularly
justification: Interviewee states they do not eat much beef or pork but eat a lot of chicken and turkey, suggesting that avoiding some meats is supported by regular consumption of others.

stance_1: I avoid eating much beef or pork
stance_2: I reduced beef due to mad cow disease
justification: The interviewee explicitly links their avoidance of beef to the habit formed during the mad cow disease period.

stance_1: I eat chicken and turkey regularly
justification: Interviewee explicitly states the belief that chicken might be healthier as one reason for their frequent consumption of chicken.

stance_1: I eat chicken and turkey regularly
justification: Interviewee lists both chicken/turkey and eggs as regular protein sources, supporting each other as part of their dietary pattern.

stance_1: I eat chicken and turkey regularly
stance_2: I want a source of protein
justification: Interviewee states they want a source of protein, which motivates their regular consumption of chicken and turkey.

stance_2: I want a source of protein
justification: Eating eggs is explicitly motivated by the desire for a protein source.

stance_2: My family eats meat in moderation
justification: Interviewee states that their own moderate meat consumption follows the family model.

stance_2: My aunt promoted healthy eating habits
justification: Interviewee links moderate consumption to following health guidance from their aunt, a nursing professor.

stance_2: I try to avoid processed food
justification: Eating meat in moderation aligns with the intent to avoid processed food, both framed as part of a healthy eating approach.

stance_2: I try to avoid processed food
justification: Interviewee states explicitly that financial limitations make it hard to avoid processed foods.
Belief in chicken's health benefits supports the approach of moderation in meat consumption.

stance_1: I try to avoid processed food
stance_2: My family eats meat in moderation
justification: Family's moderate, home-cooked, and unprocessed eating habits are described as a model the interviewee tries to follow.
